column2: Agrarian government reflects the ideals of La Hermandad, that the people and their labor should be the first concern of every ruler. Rulers are expected to put their people's concerns first and even to labor in the field alongside them when the harvest is brought in. Elections are usually favored over direct hereditary succession, and collectivism is championed as an ideal that reflects the will of the people rather than that just of its rulers.
This man is a venerated La Hermandad elder.

This character is a man of the cloth. A sworn celibate.
This character is a veteran Bracero.
This character refused to take up arms in defense of the La Hermandad faith, and is shunned by other La Hermandad faithful as a result.
The Era of Huelgas has Begun\n

Yakima, the breadbasket of the Pacific Northwest and the homeland of La Hermandad, has fallen to outside forces. Braceros across the country are in an uproar with calls for a strike or huelga to retake Yakima from the invaders, from the lowest worker to the highest boss.

[Root.GetTitledName] has drawn up the Plan of [New.GetTitledName] and declared a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName] against the adherents of '[New.Religion.GetHighGodName]'. All true [Root.Religion.GetName] men are called to arms in the name of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!\n\nJust as their ancestors did, La Hermandad will march for victory or death.

[Root.GetTitledName] has drawn up the Plan of [From.GetFullBaseName] and declared a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName] against [New.GetTitledName] and the adherents of '[New.Religion.GetHighGodName]'. All true [Root.Religion.GetName] men are called to arms in the name of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!\n\The unequal ways of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] will be removed from the Earth!

[Root.GetTitledName] has declared a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName] against [New.GetTitledName] and the [New.Religion.GetName] scabs in [From.GetFullBaseName]! All true [Root.Religion.GetName] men are called to arms against the wreckers of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!\n\nThe profaners of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will pay with their lives!

To [Root.GetTitledFirstName]:

The men of your realm are hereby called to join the Huelga. Please muster your strikers and report for duty.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Those accused of being scabs and sapos can redeem themselves by joining the Huelga. It is the time to serve.
